intro: Rosa tomentosa var. conjungens, commonly known as the woolly rose or Chinese rose, is a shrub native to China and Korea. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-white pubescent foliage and clusters of fragrant, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces small, orange-red hips in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it both aesthetically pleasing and ecologically valuable in native habitats.
